learning.supervised

Class DiscreteClassifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • learning.supervised.DiscreteClassifier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Citable, java.io.Serializable, ValidateableInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DCT_ID3, DNaiveBayes, DOneRule, DWeightedNaiveBayes, DZeroRule, KNNNB, LWNB

    public abstract class DiscreteClassifier
extends java.lang.Object
implements ValidateableInterface, java.io.Serializable, Citable
    This class implements the methods used for classifier training and testing on discretized data instances.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setCombinedMetric

        public void setCombinedMetric(CombinedMetric cmet)
        Parameters:
        cmet - CombinedMetric object for distance calculations. It may be used in hybrid methods that combine the information from the discretized and non-discretized data sources.

      • getCombinedMetric

        public CombinedMetric getCombinedMetric()
        Returns:
        CombinedMetric object for distance calculations. It may be used in hybrid methods that combine the information from the discretized and non-discretized data sources.

        public ClassificationEstimator test(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,

        Parameters:

        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        pointDistances - float[][] representing a matrix of distances from the training points to the test points.

      • test

        public ClassificationEstimator test(float[] correctPointClassificationArray,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,
                           java.lang.Object dataType,
                           int numClasses,
                           float[][] pointDistances,
                           int[][] pointNeighbors)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ValidateableInterface
        This method tests and evaluates the classifier, while keeping track of correct classifications for each class.
        Specified by:
        test in interface ValidateableInterface
        Parameters:
        correctPointClassificationArray - float[] representing the counter of correct class-specific classifications, for latter analysis.
        indexes - ArrayList of test data indexes.
        dataType - Object that is the test data context. It can correspond to dense and sparse DataSet objects, as well as a DiscretizedDataSet data context.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        pointDistances - float[][] representing a matrix of distances from the training points to the test points.
        pointNeighbors - int[][] representing and array of arrays of k-nearest neighbor indexes for the test data points among the training data, for kNN-based classification methods.
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator containing the resulting classification quality measures.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • test

        public ClassificationEstimator test(float[] correctPointClassificationArray,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,

        testLabelArray - int[] representing the separate test data label array.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        pointDistances - float[][] representing a matrix of distances from the training points to the test points.
        pointNeighbors - int[][] representing and array of arrays of k-nearest neighbor indexes for the test data points among the training data, for kNN-based classification methods.
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator containing the resulting classification quality measures.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • test

        public ClassificationEstimator test(float[][] predictedProbLabelsAllData,
                           float[] correctPointClassificationArray,
                           DiscreteCategory[] testClasses)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method evaluates the trained model on the test data.
        Parameters:
        predictedProbLabelsAllData - float[][] representing the current predicted fuzzy labels for all data points (not only the test points in the current iteration, but rather all points from the original data.)
        correctPointClassificationArray - float[] that is updated with the total point-wise classification precision.
        testClasses - DiscreteCategory[] representing the test data.
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator holding the classifier evaluation quality metrics.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • test

        public ClassificationEstimator test(float[][] predictedProbLabelsAllData,
                           float[] correctPointClassificationArray,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,
                           java.lang.Object dataType,
                           int numClasses)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ValidateableInterface
        This method tests and evaluates the classifier, while keeping track of correct classifications for each class.
        Specified by:
        test in interface ValidateableInterface
        Parameters:
        predictedProbLabelsAllData - float[][] representing the current predicted fuzzy labels for all data points (not only the test points in the current iteration, but rather all points from the original data.)
        correctPointClassificationArray - float[] representing the counter of correct class-specific classifications, for latter analysis.
        indexes - ArrayList of test data indexes.
        dataType - Object that is the test data context. It can correspond to dense and sparse DataSet objects, as well as a DiscretizedDataSet data context.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator containing the resulting classification quality measures.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • test

        public ClassificationEstimator test(float[][] predictedProbLabelsAllData,
                           float[] correctPointClassificationArray,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,
                           java.lang.Object dataType,
                           int numClasses,
                           float[][] pointDistances,
                           int[][] pointNeighbors)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ValidateableInterface
        This method tests and evaluates the classifier, while keeping track of correct classifications for each class.
        Specified by:
        test in interface ValidateableInterface
        Parameters:
        predictedProbLabelsAllData - float[][] representing the current predicted fuzzy labels for all data points (not only the test points in the current iteration, but rather all points from the original data.)
        correctPointClassificationArray - float[] representing the counter of correct class-specific classifications, for latter analysis.
        indexes - ArrayList of test data indexes.
        dataType - Object that is the test data context. It can correspond to dense and sparse DataSet objects, as well as a DiscretizedDataSet data context.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        pointDistances - float[][] representing a matrix of distances from the training points to the test points.
        pointNeighbors - int[][] representing and array of arrays of k-nearest neighbor indexes for the test data points among the training data, for kNN-based classification methods.
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator containing the resulting classification quality measures.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
